name: Manchester Coffee Festival 2026
description:
The North's largest coffee gathering takes over Bowlers Exhibition Centre for a weekend of roaster showcases and live competitions. UK specialty roasters pour samples at booth after booth while equipment brands demonstrate grinders and espresso machines. Panel discussions cover sustainability, direct trade, and café business models with Northern roasters and café owners.

Cupping sessions run hourly in the tasting lab. Latte art throwdowns and brewing competitions draw crowds around the main stage. The festival's independent ethos keeps the focus on small-batch roasters and emerging brands rather than large commercial exhibitors.

city.name: Manchester
city.story: Manchester's industrial heritage meets modern coffee culture, with converted warehouses housing some of the North's finest roasters.

name: Coffex Istanbul 2026
description:
The 8th Istanbul Coffee Expo brings trade buyers and equipment suppliers to Lütfi Kırdar Congress Centre for three days of B2B networking. Turkish and international roasters exhibit alongside espresso machine manufacturers, grinder brands, and packaging companies. The expo floor spans multiple halls with dedicated zones for green coffee traders and café fit-out specialists.

Seminar tracks cover roasting techniques, café operations, and market trends across Turkey and the Middle East. Barista demonstrations run on the main stage. Trade-only admission keeps the focus on industry professionals sourcing equipment and establishing supply relationships.
physicalLocation: Lütfi Kırdar Congress and Exhibition Centre, Istanbul

city.name: Istanbul
city.story: Where East meets West, Istanbul's coffee culture bridges centuries-old Turkish traditions with modern specialty coffee innovations.
city.headline: this is the sample headline

eventHostBrand.name: Coffex Istanbul
eventHostBrand.story: ENC Fair and Event Group launched Coffex Istanbul around 2019, growing it into the Middle East's largest B2B platform for coffee. Held at Lütfi Kırdar Congress Centre in Harbiye, the trade fair connects Turkish and international buyers with equipment manufacturers, green coffee traders, and roasting technology suppliers. By 2022 it drew 20,000 visitors and over 300 brands, with each edition naming a focus country.

gaps: Exact founding year (can be inferred as 2019 if 2024 was 6th edition, but not explicitly stated)
Total square meters of exhibition space
Number of countries represented by exhibitors
Economic impact or business volume generated
Specific exhibitor lists and company names

facts.claim: Coffex Istanbul is Turkey's only expo devoted entirely to coffee and its services
Coffex Istanbul is the biggest international trade fair and promotion platform for coffee and supporting industries in Middle East
The fourth edition of Coffex Istanbul was held March 17-20, 2022 at Haliç Congress Center
The 2022 edition expected up to 20,000 domestic and international visitors
The 2021 edition had over 17,000 visitors from all over the world
The 2022 edition featured approximately 70 companies serving the coffee industry
The 2022 edition represented over 300 brands globally
The 2021 edition was held September 15-18 at Haliç Congress Center
Indonesia was Focus Country at the 2021 edition, their first participation
A 2019 edition took place on April 25, 2019 at Istanbul Congress Center
The 6th edition was held in 2024, identified as '6. Uluslararası Kahve Fuarı'
The 7th edition is scheduled for May 9-11, 2025 at Lütfi Kırdar Congress Center
The 2025 edition features over 100 firms including coffee-producing countries India, Uganda, Ecuador, and Indonesia
India is selected as Focus Country for the 2025 edition
The 8th edition is scheduled for May 8-10, 2026 at Lütfi Kırdar Congress and Expo Center
Coffex Istanbul is organized by ENC Fair and Event Group
The organizer's address is Silver Harbiye Cad. No: 4 34367 Harbiye / Sisli / Istanbul, Turkey
Lütfi Kırdar International Convention and Exhibition Center is located at Harbiye, Darülbedai Caddesi No:4, 34367 Şişli/İstanbul
Haliç Congress Center is located at Karaağaç Cd No:48, 34445 Beyoğlu/İstanbul on the shores of Golden Horn
Coffex Istanbul brings around 110 exhibitors to participate

name: ASEAN Coffee Roasting Championship 2026
description:
The ASEAN Coffee Federation's inaugural regional roasting competition runs during THAIFEX – HOREC Asia at IMPACT Muang Thong Thani. Two categories, Professional and Home, put roasters through ACF Coffee Appreciation standards. Competitors roast sample batches judged on profile development, consistency, and interpretation of ASEAN-origin beans.

The championship targets both established roasters and emerging talent from the ten ASEAN member states. Thailand, Vietnam, Indonesia, and the Philippines send the largest contingents. Winners advance to represent the region at international events.

city.name: Bangkok
city.story:
Thailand has historically had many claims for tourism, with coffee likely to fall far behind the popular draws of sun, spicy food and some rather more blue pastimes. So it may be a surprise to learn that in 2026, Bangkok can lay claim to being one of the most impressive coffee capitals in the world.

What makes Bangkok such a compelling city for coffee nerds? The overwhelming majority of shops roast their own beans, often maintaining direct farm relationships with producers in the mountainous north, particularly around Chiang Mai and Chiang Rai. It isn't just domestic origins either; you'll find single-origin offerings from across the globe, with Ethiopian, Panamanian and Colombian lots sitting comfortably alongside homegrown Thai and Lao varieties.

Expect each shop to stock a minimum of two different roasts for espresso. It's not uncommon for even the smallest, most humble independent outlet to have three beans loaded in grinders at any given time. The roast spectrum skews lighter than you might expect, with medium and light-medium profiles dominating. Anaerobic fermentation, carbonic maceration and experimental naturals all feature prominently.

The interiors are just as varied. Ultra-modern, glass-fronted architectural showcases sit alongside stripped-back, raw-concrete aesthetics and more traditional, warmly furnished shopfronts. The design ambition on display often rivals dedicated studio spaces rather than mere cafés.

Regional and national chains have also flourished. Operators like 1:2, BEANS and Roots have become ubiquitous fixtures across the capital's numerous malls, though the line between chain and independent is far less stark than in most Western cities. The term "speciality" doesn't hold much relevance in Bangkok as a differentiator among scores of shops. The quality floor is already so high that the label is practically redundant. Great coffee isn't confined to the core tourist and expat hubs around Sukhumvit, Silom and Songwat either. Vast selections of quality shops in areas like Bang Na and Chatuchak demonstrate just how widespread the city's appetite for coffee runs.

Despite the city's reputation for affordability, prices for coffee can rival what you might expect to pay in Europe. Imported lighter roasts in particular command significant premiums, and a single pour-over from a sought-after lot can comfortably exceed what you'd spend in London or Berlin.

If any criticism could be drawn, it would be that the city's coffee culture keeps early hours. You may struggle after 4PM to find a quality cup outside of kiosk outlets within the malls. This isn't unique to Bangkok — Tokyo, Seoul and Taipei all follow a similar pattern — but it catches out visitors accustomed to European evening café culture.

None of this is commercialised to appeal to the Western visitor's palate. There's a voracious domestic demand, and like most aspects of Thai culture, there is none of the pretentiousness which can plague speciality coffee in the West. As a coffee purist, you almost have to recalibrate your instincts. Shops pairing espresso with orange juice, infusing drinks with all manner of toppings and syrups. These aren't red flags here. The same counter serving a lurid orange-topped iced latte may also pour you one of the finest washed, anaerobically fermented filter cups you've ever tasted.

name: London Coffee Festival 2026
description:
The UK's largest coffee event returns to Brick Lane's Truman Brewery for four days of tastings, competitions, and trade. Industry days on Thursday and Friday feature workshops and seminars for professionals. The Coffee Masters tournament runs across all four days, with baristas competing in knockout rounds. Roasters Village showcases UK and European roasters alongside equipment manufacturers.

Public days on Saturday and Sunday draw 22,000 visitors to sample from 275 exhibitors. Latte Art Live, Brew School, and cocktail masterclasses run throughout. Street food vendors and acoustic sets fill the courtyard spaces between tasting sessions.
physicalLocation: The Truman Brewery, 91 Brick Lane, London E1 6QL

city.name: London
city.story: London's coffee scene is a melting pot of international influences, from traditional Italian espresso bars to Nordic-style light roasts.

name: Marrakech Coffee & Tea Festival 2026
description:
The second edition of Morocco's international coffee and tea gathering runs for three days against the Atlas Mountain backdrop at Mossalla Sidi Amara. Over 150 exhibitors showcase beans, brewing equipment, and tea blends to 30,000 expected visitors. The Moroccan Barista Championship and Tea Masters competition crown national champions across espresso, latte art, and tea preparation categories.

Workshops cover roasting profiles, cupping technique, and traditional Moroccan tea ceremony. International speakers join local industry leaders for panel sessions on North African coffee market development. Evening events blend coffee culture with Marrakech's hospitality traditions.

city.name: Marrakesh
city.story: Marrakesh boasts Morocco's most developed speciality coffee scene, with a couple of high-quality establishments serving the city's considerable tourist population.

name: World of Coffee Bangkok 2026
description:
Thailand's first World of Coffee brings the SCA's flagship trade show to BITEC for three days of exhibitions, competitions, and workshops. The World Cup Tasters Championship runs on the main stage, testing competitors' speed and palate accuracy across triangulation rounds. Exporum and the Barista Association of Thailand co-produce alongside SCA.

Exhibition halls feature roasting equipment, green bean traders, and brewing gear from manufacturers across Asia and Europe. Cupping sessions and brew bars run throughout the venue. The event follows successful editions in Busan and Jakarta, marking the third World of Coffee Asia. Registration opens to trade professionals and coffee enthusiasts.

eventHostBrand.name: Specialty Coffee Association
eventHostBrand.story: SCA sets quality standards including the Coffee Value Assessment, runs the World Coffee Championships, and produces World of Coffee trade shows across three continents. The Q Grader Program is specialty coffee's leading professional certification. Headquarters in California with regional offices in Europe and Asia.

facts.claim: The Specialty Coffee Association is the world's largest global coffee trade association established in January 2017 through the unification of the Specialty Coffee Association of America (founded 1982) and the Speciality Coffee Association of Europe (founded 1998)
SCA describes itself as 'the global stage for specialty coffee, where culture, commerce and community collide'
Its purpose is to foster a global coffee community and support activities to make specialty coffee a thriving, equitable, and sustainable endeavor for the entire value chain
SCA operates globally recognized education programs reaching almost 80,000 learners annually across 89 countries in 40 languages

Education programs include the Q Grader Program (specialty coffee's leading professional license), Skills Diplomas in café, roastery, coffee trade, and sustainability, and introductory cupping workshops
SCA hosts major international trade shows including World of Coffee (celebrated in multiple regions), with 2026 events planned in Europe, Asia, North America, and Latin America

The organization conducts research on industry issues and develops standards, including the Coffee Value Assessment (CVA), a modern framework for evaluating specialty coffee that replaced the traditional cupping system
SCA offers both company memberships (based on team size and revenue) and individual professional memberships for coffee professionals, with a free Associate Membership option also available
SCA's sustainability-driven purpose is to foster thriving, equitable, and sustainable coffee communities across the entire value chain
The organization focuses on creating and equitably distributing value among all actors in the coffee industry, addressing root causes like the 2018-2019 price crisis
Website: https://sca.coffee
Instagram handle: @specialtycoffeeassociation

eventHostBrand.statement: World's largest specialty coffee trade association, 80,000 learners annually.
